name: places/ChIJ6bA9Axj2wokRWzSob4p6Ti4
formattedAddress: 301 Cathedral Pkwy, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 301 Cathedral Pkwy, New York, NY 10026, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store offering road, hybrid, children's & other bikes, plus accessories, plus rentals & service.

originalText.text: I am a quad roller skater and I was having trouble locating a 17mm flat wrench (used for bikes, skates etc). After going to 6 different bike shops on the east side I was skating home (feeling defeated) and saw this shop. I was greeted with smiles, learned something about my own skates and a repair was made and the man wouldn’t even take 5 dollars. To him it was 15 seconds of help to me it was a prayer answered that I had almost given up on. This is Harlem!!!! Thank you! God Bless you!!!!

originalText.text: Been going here for 8 years. They're humble, fast, and know what they're doing. Brought my bike here to tighten a loose headset and they fixed what another bike store couldn't. They discovered deeper problems with some broken bearings and fixed the issue thoroughly. Then they used their high skills to make micro adjustments throughout my bike so everything would be better, from tightening my brake to adjusting my kickstand. Thanks for keeping me on the road and safe, Larry and crew!

originalText.text: I've been here twice so far, I would highly recommend. First time I went to use their bike pump (free), I was kinda struggling to fill up the air and a guy from the shop helped me out. Second time I went to change the inner tube because my front tire kept deflating, the service was super quick (10 min) and the price was very reasonable.

text.text: I've been here twice so far, I would highly recommend. First time I went to use their bike pump (free), I was kinda struggling to fill up the air and a guy from the shop helped me out. Second time I went to change the inner tube because my front tire kept deflating, the service was super quick (10 min) and the price was very reasonable.

originalText.text: Love these guys. They're good, fast, professional, friendly, and not at all pretentious. My bike is a 30-year old Canondale rigid fork mountain bike with a home-done paint job and basic mid-shelf components. It's a tank. Nothing special (except to me). You might get a couple hundred bucks if you tried to sell it. And yet Larry's treats me just as well as if I had a $7,000 bike.

text.text: Love these guys. They're good, fast, professional, friendly, and not at all pretentious. My bike is a 30-year old Canondale rigid fork mountain bike with a home-done paint job and basic mid-shelf components. It's a tank. Nothing special (except to me). You might get a couple hundred bucks if you tried to sell it. And yet Larry's treats me just as well as if I had a $7,000 bike.

originalText.text:
Paid $50 to box my bicycle from here (near to Columbia campus so first place most people will likely go) to ship to Palo Alto, California. Paid another $180 for the service "bikeflights" to create the shipping label to add to the boxed bicycle.

My god what a terrible job they did. Took it to a real bike shop in Palo Alto and they told me they just took an old used bike box and put my bicycle in there and shipped it out to California. No padding inside either. I would have happily paid more than $50 for them to use a new bicycle box and add some extra level of protection to ship my bicycle.

If you're going to ship or box your bicycle definitely go elsewhere!
